definition: to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: It works by turning the sounds of the dental consulting room into a digital signal.
sentences.chinese: 它的工作原理是将口腔诊室内的声音转化为数字信号。

sentences.english: The tower’s basement is to undergo reconstruction to make the tower capable of transmitting digitally.
sentences.chinese: 为了使电视塔能够发射数字信号，地下室将接受改造。

sentences.english: Any circuit will pass a digital signa.
sentences.chinese: 任何电路可以通过一个特定的数字信号。

sentences.english: An implementation of Pipelined digital signal generator is provided.
sentences.chinese: 为实现流水线数字信号产生器提供了一种实现方案。

sentences.english: Any circuit will pass a digital signa practically undistorted .
sentences.chinese: 任何电路可以通过一个特定的数字信号。

sentences.english: The two digital signal types are the on-off signal and the pulse train signal.
sentences.chinese: 这两类数字信号分别为通断信号和脉冲序列信号。

sentences.english: The last two letters look like a 1 and 0, representing the digital signal.
sentences.chinese: 最后两个字母表示1和0，代表点子数字信号。

definition: filtering radio waves (i.e. to pick out one frequency)
